quotes.message: One of the great attractions of patriotism - it fulfills our worst wishes. In the person of our nation we are able, vicariously, to bully and cheat. Bully and cheat, what's more, with a feeling that we are profoundly virtuous.
quotes.name: Aldous Huxley

quotes.message: A soldier will fight long and hard for a bit of colored ribbon.
quotes.name: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.message: Real patriotism is a willingness to challenge the government when it's wrong.
quotes.name: Ron Paul

quotes.message: Patriotism is the last refuge of the scoundrel.
quotes.name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.message: One flag, one land, one heart, one hand, One Nation evermore!
quotes.name: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.message: Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe, to assure the survival and success of liberty.
quotes.name: John F. Kennedy

quotes.message: If our country is worth dying for in time of war let us resolve that it is truly worth living for in time of peace.
quotes.name: Hamilton Fish

quotes.message: The urge to save humanity is almost always a false face for the urge to rule it.
quotes.name: H.L. Mencken

quotes.message: The love of one's country is a splendid thing.
quotes.name: Pablo Casals

quotes.message: Our country is not the only thing to which we owe our allegiance. It is also owed to justice and to humanity. Patriotism consists not in waving the flag, but in striving that our country shall be righteous as well as strong.
quotes.name: James Bryce

quotes.message: It is sweet to serve one's country by deeds, and it is not absurd to serve her by words.
quotes.name: Sallust

quotes.message: It is the love of country that has lighted and that keeps glowing the holy fire of patriotism.
quotes.name: J. Horace Mcfarland

quotes.message: My kind of loyalty was loyalty to one's country, not to its institutions or its office-holders.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: He loves his country best who strives to make it best.
quotes.name: Robert G. Ingersoll

quotes.message: Men love their country, not because it is great, but because it is their own.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: Patriotism is your conviction that this country is superior to all other countries because you were born in it.
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: Patriotism is easy to understand in America - it means looking out for yourself by looking out for your country.
quotes.name: Calvin Coolidge

quotes.message: A man's country is not a certain area of land, of mountains, rivers, and woods, but it is a principle; and patriotism is loyalty to that principle.
quotes.name: George William Curtis

quotes.message: Loyalty to country ALWAYS. Loyalty to government, when it deserves it.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: There is no flag large enough to cover the shame of killing innocent people for a purpose which is unattainable.
quotes.name: Howard Zinn

quotes.message: I am an American; free born and free bred, where I acknowledge no man as my superior, except for his own worth, or as my inferior, except for his own demerit.
quotes.name: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.message: A patriot must always be ready to defend his country against his government.
quotes.name: Edward Abbey

quotes.message: It is not always the same thing to be a good man and a good citizen.
quotes.name: Aristotle

quotes.message: Patriotism is the virtue of the vicious.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: A love for tradition has never weakened a nation, indeed it has strengthened nations in their hour of peril.
quotes.name: Winston S. Churchill

quotes.message: The greatest patriotism is to tell your country when it is behaving dishonorably, foolishly, viciously.
quotes.name: Julian Barnes

quotes.message: Patriots always talk of dying for their country but never of killing for their country.
quotes.name: Bertrand Russell

quotes.message: I love my country, not my government.
quotes.name: Jesse Ventura

quotes.message: To oppose corruption in government is the highest obligation of patriotism.
quotes.name: G. Edward Griffin

quotes.message: By patriotism is meant, not only spontaneous, instinctive love for one's own nation, and preference for it above all other nations, but also the belief that such love and preference are good and useful.
quotes.name: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.message: When a whole nation is roaring patriotism at the top of its voice, I am fain to explore the cleanness of its hands and the purity of its heart.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: A man's feet must be planted in his country, but his eyes should survey the world.
quotes.name: George Santayana

quotes.message: True patriots we; for be it understood we left our country for our country's good.
quotes.name: George Barrington

quotes.message: The greatness of a nation can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
quotes.name: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.message: Patriotism, when it wants to make itself felt in the domain of learning, is a dirty fellow who should be thrown out of doors.
quotes.name: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.message: Ask not what your country can do for you, ask what you can do for your country.
quotes.name: John F. Kennedy

quotes.message: Though I love my country, I do not love my countrymen.
quotes.name: Lord Byron

quotes.message: To make us love our country, our country ought to be lovely.
quotes.name: Edmund Burke

quotes.message: True patriotism is not worship of our nation but rather, in the light of our worship of the God of justice, to conform our nation's ways of justice.
quotes.name: Robert Mcafee Brown

quotes.message: True patriotism sometimes requires of men to act exactly contrary, at one period, to that which it does at another, and the motive which impels them the desire to do right is precisely the same.
quotes.name: Robert E. Lee

quotes.message: My Country! When right keep it right; when wrong, set it right!
quotes.name: Carl Schurz

quotes.message: Patriotism does not oblige us to acquiesce in the destruction of liberty. Patriotism obliges us to question it, at least.
quotes.name: Wendy Kaminer

quotes.message: Patriotism is a religion, the egg from which wars are hatched.
quotes.name: Guy De Maupassant

quotes.message: Patriotism is a menace to liberty.
quotes.name: Emma Goldman

quotes.message: You'll never have a quiet world until you knock the patriotism out of the human race.
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: Blind patriotism has been kept intact by rewriting history to provide people with moral consolation and a psychological basis for denial.
quotes.name: William H. Boyer

quotes.message: During times of war, hatred becomes quite respectable even though it has to masquerade often under the guise of patriotism.
quotes.name: Howard Thurman

quotes.message: A true patriot never abandons his country at the hour of need.
quotes.name: Auliq Ice

quotes.message: What is light is to the eyes, what air is to be lungs, what love is to the heart, liberty is to be the soul of man.
quotes.name: Robert Ingersoll

quotes.message: A good country song taps into strong undercurrents of family, faith and patriotism.
quotes.name: George W. Bush

quotes.message: I believe in America because we have great dreams and because we have the opportunity to make those dreams come true.
quotes.name: Wendell L. Wilkie

quotes.message: America is another name for opportunity. Our whole history appears like a last effort of divine providence on behalf of the human race.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
quotes.name: Martinn Luther King Jr.

quotes.message: Every good citizen makes his country's honor his own, and cherishes it not only as precious but as sacred.
quotes.name: Andrew Jackson

quotes.message: I saw my grandson off to war. My grandson, heads for danger, bear, and sand. Alone.
quotes.name: Carolyn Howard-Johnson

quotes.message: I wish that every human life might be pure transparent freedom.
quotes.name: Simone De Beauvoir

quotes.message: A patriotism which is not short, frenzied outbursts of emotion, but the tranquil and steady dedication of a lifetime.
quotes.name: Adlai E. Stevenson

quotes.message: Guard against the impostures of pretended patriotism.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.message: It is impossible to govern a nation without God and the Bible.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.message: Liberty, when it begins to take root, is a plant of rapid growth.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.message: The constitution is the guide which I will never abandon.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.message: A war for a great principle ennobles a nation.
quotes.name: Albert Pike

quotes.message: When the sword is once drawn, the passions of men observe no bounds of moderation.
quotes.name: Alexander Hamilton

quotes.message: I am not afraid of an army of lions led by a sheep, I am afraud of an army of sheep led by a lion.
quotes.name: Alexander The Great

quotes.message: If the union is once severed, the line of separation will grow wider and wider, and the controversies which are now debated and settled in the halls of legislation will then be tried in field of battle and determined by the sword.
quotes.name: Andrew Jackson

quotes.message: As long as our government is administered for the good of the people, and is regulated by their will; as long as it secures is the rights of persons and of property, liberty of conscience and of the press, it will be worth defending.
quotes.name: Andrew Jackson

quotes.message: The brave man inattentive of his duty, is worth little more to his country than the coward who deserts in the hour of danger.
quotes.name: Andrew Jackson

quotes.message: True independence and freedom can only exist in doing what is right.
quotes.name: Brigham Young

quotes.message: Patriotism consists not in waving the flag, but in striving that our country shall be righteous as well as strong.
quotes.name: James Bryce

quotes.message: It is foolish and wrong to mourn the men who died, Rather we should thank God that such men lived.
quotes.name: George S. Patton

quotes.message: The patriot volunteer, fighting for our country and his rights, makes the most reliable soldier on earth.
quotes.name: Thomas J Jackson

quotes.message: The nation that forgets its defenders will itself be forgotten.
quotes.name: Calvin Coolidge

quotes.message: Over the years, the United States has sent many of its fine young men and women into great peril to fight for freedom beyond our borders. The only amount of land we have ever asked for in (consequence) is enough to bury those who did not return.
quotes.name: Colin Powell

quotes.message: I do not believe that war and military service are the only means to honor America. God grants us all the privilege of having our character and our patriotism tested.
quotes.name: John McCain

quotes.message: Those who wear the uniform of the United States know better than anyone the meaning of American Citizenship.
quotes.name: John McCain

quotes.message: A young man who does not have what it takes to perform military service is not likely to have what it takes to make a living.
quotes.name: John F. Kennedy

quotes.message: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is braver five minutes longer.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: These men came here to storm these beaches for one purpose only, not to gain anything for ourselves, not to fulfill any ambitions that America had for conquest, but just to preserve freedom. Many thousands of men have died for such ideals as these, but these young boys were cut of in their prime.
quotes.name: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.message: One man with courage makes a majority.
quotes.name: Andrew Jackson

quotes.message: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
quotes.name: Thomas Paine

quotes.message: It's the soldier not the reporter who gives you the freedom of the press.
quotes.name: John Hagee

quotes.message: It's the soldier not the campus organizer who allows you to demonstrate.
quotes.name: John Hagee

quotes.message: It is an unfortunate fact that we can secure peace only by preparing for war.
quotes.name: John F. Kennedy

quotes.message: I may be compelled to face danger, but never fear it, and while our soldiers can stand and fight, I can stand and feed and nurse them.
quotes.name: Clara Barton

quotes.message: So long as we have enough people in this country willing to fight for their rights, we'll be call a democracy.
quotes.name: Roger Baldwin

quotes.message: We confide in our strength, without boasting of it; we respect that of others, without fearing it.
quotes.name: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.message: Victories that are easy are cheap. Those only are worth having which come as the result of hard fighting.
quotes.name: Henry Ward Beecher
